subject: thoughts to live by
verse: As far as the gospel is concerned, they are enemies on your account; but as far as election is concerned, they are loved, on account of the patriarchs, for God's gifts and His call are irrevocable. Just as you were at one time disobedient to God have now received mercy as a result of their disobedience, so they too have now become disobedient in order that they too may now receive mercy as a result of God's mercy to you. For God has bound all men over to disobedience so that He may have mercy on them all. (Romans 11:28-32) NIV
reflection: Here Is What We Are To Glean From This: In this passage Paul shows how the Jews and the Gentiles benefit from each other. When ever God shows mercy to one group, the other shares the blessing. In God's original plan, the Jews would be the source of God's blessing to the Gentiles (Genesis 12:3). When the Jews neglected this mission, God blessed the Gentiles anyway through the Jewish Messiah. He still maintained His love for the Jews because of His promises to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. But someday all faithful Jews will share in God's mercy. God's plan will not be thwarted: He will have mercy on everyone.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for You mercies which are new everyday. Help me to love as You do, Help me to be merciful as You are merciful. Bless and keep all my friends safe. Keep our nation, its citizens and our troops save today I pray. Amen.
original_content:
God's Blessing on You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God loves us all, even though 
we do not deserve it...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

As far as the gospel is concerned, they are enemies on your
account; but as far as election is concerned, they are loved, on
account of the patriarchs,

for God's gifts and His call are irrevocable...

Just as you were at one time disobedient to God have now
received mercy as a result of their disobedience,

so they too have now become disobedient in order that they 
too may now receive mercy as a result of God's mercy to you...

For God has bound all men over to disobedience so that He
may have mercy on them all...(Ro. 11:28-32) NIV

Here Is What We Are To Glean From This:

In this passage Paul shows how the Jews and the Gentiles benefit
from each other. When ever God shows mercy to one group, the 
other shares the blessing...

In God's original plan, the Jews would be the source of God's blessing
to the Gentiles (Gen. 12:3). When the Jews neglected this mission, 
God blessed the Gentiles anyway through the Jewish Messiah...

He still maintained His love for the Jews because of His promises to 
Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. But someday all faithful Jews will share 
in God's mercy...

God's plan will not be thwarted: He will "have mercy on everyone."

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for You mercies which are new everyday.
Help me to love as You do, Help me to be merciful as You are merciful. 
Bless and keep all my e-mail friends safe. Keep our nation, its citizens and 
our troops save today I pray...Amen.

Keep looking up, He loves us one and all...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Oh, the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable His judgments, and His paths beyond tracing out! (Romans 11:33) NIV
reflection: We should notice that this doxology is a prayer of praise to God for the wisdom of His plan. Even though God's methods and means are beyond our comprehension, God Himself is not arbitrary. He governs the universe and our life in perfect wisdom, justice, and love. He governs us by His love ~~ that is why we don't receive what we deserve.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, great are Your ways and beyond understanding. Take my life and let it be consecrated Lord to Thee: take my moments and my days, ~~ let them flow in ceaseless praise. Amen.
original_content:
God's Blessings on You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Oh, the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God!
How unsearchable His judgments, and His paths beyond tracing out!
(Ro. 11:33) NIV

Our Lesson Here:

We should notice that this doxology is a prayer of praise to God for 
the wisdom of His plan...

Even though God's methods and means are beyond our comprehension,
God Himself is not arbitrary. He governs the universe and our life in 
perfect wisdom, justice, and love...

He governs us by His love ~~ that is why we don't receive what we deserve...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, great are Your ways and beyond understanding.
Take my life and let it be consecrated Lord to Thee: take my moments
and my days, ~~ let them flow in ceaseless praise...Amen.

Keep looking up, that the Lord may guide your way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: Who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been His counselor?" "Who has ever given to God, that God should repay him?" (Romans 11:34, 35) NIV
reflection: Here Is What We Should Glean From These Verses: Really the implication of these verses is that no one has fully understood the mind of the Lord. No one has been His counselor ~~ and God owes nothing to any one of us. Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to give advice to God or criticize His ways (Isaiah 40:13; Jeremiah 23:18). God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray today for godly wisdom, that I might walk in righteousness and truth. Forgive me for my sins of thought, word, and deed. Instill in me a clean heart O God. Amen.
original_content:
God Bless You Real Good Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~With God all things are possible...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: Who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has
been His counselor?"

"Who has ever given to God, that God should repay him?" (Ro. 11:34, 35) NIV

Here Is What We Should Glean From These Verses:

Really the implication of these verses is that no one has fully understood
the mind of the Lord...

No one has been His counselor ~~ and God owes nothing to any one of us.

Isaiah and Jeremiah asked similar questions to show that we are unable to
give advice to God or criticize His ways (Isa. 40:13; Jer. 23:18)...

God alone is the possessor of absolute power and absolute wisdom...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray today for godly wisdom,
that I might walk in righteousness and truth. Forgive me
for my sins of thought, word, and deed. Instill in me a 
clean heart O God...Amen.

Keep looking up, He waits to guide you in all things...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: From Him and through Him and to Him are all things, To Him be the glory forever! Amen. (Romans 11:36) NIV
reflection: This Is What We Should Glean From This Verse: In the final analysis, all of us are absolutely dependent on God. He is the source of all things, including ourselves. He is the power that sustains and rules the world that we live in. And God works out all things to bring glory to Himself. The all-powerful God deserves our praise.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Creator and sustained of all that exists, we praise Your holy name. By Your will all things exist. By Your mercy and love my sins have been forgiven, thank You Lord for this great and wonderful gift. Amen.
original_content:
God's Blessing On You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~He's got the whole world in His hands...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

From Him and through Him and to Him are all things,
To Him be the glory forever! Amen...(Ro. 11:36) NIV

This Is What We Should Glean From This Verse:

In the final analysis, all of us are absolutely dependent
on God. He is the source of all things, including ourselves...

He is the power that sustains and rules the world that we
live in. And God works out all things to bring glory to
Himself...

The all-powerful God deserves our praise...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Creator and sustainer of all that 
exists, we praise Your holy name. By Your will all things 
exist. By Your mercy and love my sins have been forgiven, 
thank You Lord for this great and wonderful gift...Amen.

Keep looking up, all good things come from Him...
Your are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore, I urge you, brothers, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to God~~This is your spiritual act of worship. (Romans 12:1) NIV
reflection: When sacrificing an animal according to God's law, a priest would kill the animal, cut it in pieces, and place it on the altar. Sacrifice was important, but even in the Old Testament God made it clear that obedience from the heart was much more important. God wants us to offer ourselves, not animals as living sacrifices, daily laying aside our own desires to follow Him, putting our energy and resources at His disposal and trusting Him to guide us. We are to do this out of gratitude that our sins have been forgiven.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the life I live would be pleasing to You. I do thank You for all that You have done for me, guide me so as to do more for You. Keep our nation, its citizens, and our troops safe today. Bless all who read this devotion today. Amen.
original_content:
God Bless You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~A song in your heart puts a smile on your face...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Therefore, I urge you, brothers, in view of God's mercy, 
to offer your bodies as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing
to God~~This is your spiritual act of worship...(Ro. 12:1) NIV

Here Is What We Should Glean From This:

When sacrificing an animal according to God's law, a priest would
kill the animal, cut it in pieces, and place it on the altar. Sacrifice was
important, but even in the Old Testament God made it clear that
obedience from the heart was much more important...

God wants us to offer ourselves, not animals as living sacrifices,
daily laying aside our own desires to follow Him, putting our energy 
and resources at His disposal and trusting Him to guide us...

We are to do this out of gratitude that our sins have been forgiven...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the life I live would
be pleasing to You. I do thank You for all that You have
done for me, guide me so as to do more for You.
Keep our nation, its citizens, and our troops safe today.
Bless all who read this devotion today...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will put a smile on your face...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is, His good, pleasing and perfect will. For by the grace given me I say to every one of you: Do not think of your self more highly than you ought, but rather think of yourself with sober judgment, in accordance with the measure of faith God has given you. (Romans 12:2, 3) NIV
reflection: Healthy self-esteem is important because some of us think to little of ourselves; on the other hand, some overestimate themselves. The key to an honest and accurate self-evaluation is, knowing the basis of our self-worth ~~ our identity in Christ. Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him we are valuable and capable of worthy service. Evaluating yourself by the worldly standards of success and achievement can cause you to think too much about your worth in the eyes of others and so miss your true value in God's eyes.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always evaluate my self-worth in your eyes. Help me to judge others in like manner. Keep our nation its citizens, and our troops safe today. I thank you for our troops and ask that You would bless them for protecting our way of life. Amen.
original_content:
God Bless You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Focusing on Christ puts everything in perspective...

Our Bible Verses For Today:

Do not conform any longer to the pattern of this world, but be 
transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be 
able to test and approve what God's will is, His good, pleasing 
and perfect will...

For by the grace given me I say to every one of you: Do not think 
of your self more highly than you ought, but rather think of yourself 
with sober judgment, in accordance with the measure of faith God 
has given you...(Ro. 12:2, 3) NIV

Here Is What We Should Learn From These Verses:

Healthy self-esteem is important because some of us think to little of ourselves; 
on the other hand, some overestimate themselves...

The key to an honest and accurate self-evaluation is, knowing the basis of our 
self-worth ~~ our identity in Christ...

Apart from Him, we aren't capable of very much by eternal standards; in Him we 
are valuable and capable of worthy service...

Evaluating yourself by the worldly standards of success and achievement can 
cause you to think too much about your worth in the eyes of others and so miss 
your true value in God's eyes...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always evaluate my self-worth
in your eyes. Help me to judge others in like manner. Keep our 
nation its citizens, and our troops safe today. I thank you for our 
troops and ask that You would bless them for protecting our way 
of life...Amen.

Keep looking up, He thinks you are worthy enough to die for...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Just as each of us has one body with many members, and these members do not have the same function, so in Christ we who are many form one body, and each member belongs to all the others. (Romans 12:4, 5) NIV
reflection: Paul uses the concept of the human body to teach how Christians should live and work together. Just as the parts of the body function under the direction of the brain. In like manner Christians are to work together under the command and authority of Jesus Christ. Paul writes in more detail of this in (I Corinthians 12:12-31; and Ephesians 4:1-16)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to make better use of the gifts You have given me. Help me to do my part when asked, help me to see more clearly my role in witnessing for You. Amen.
original_content:
God Bless You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~There is no excuse for saying "no" to Christ...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Just as each of us has one body with many members, and
these members do not have the same function, so in
Christ we who are many form one body, and each member 
belongs to all the others...(Ro. 12:4, 5) NIV

Here Is What We Should Glean From This:

Paul uses the concept of the human body to teach how
Christians should live and work together. Just as the parts 
of the body function under the direction of the brain...

In like manner Christians are to work together under the 
command and authority of Jesus Christ...

Paul writes in more detail of this in (I Cor. 12:12-31; and Eph. 4:1-16)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to make better use of
the gifts You have given me. Help me to do my part when
asked, help me to see more clearly my role in witnessing
for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will clarify your part in sharing your faith...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We have different gifts according to the grace given to us. If a man's gift is prophesying, let him use it in proportion to his faith. If it is serving, let him serve; if it is teaching, let him teach; If it is encouraging, let him encourage; if it is contributing, to the needs of others, let him give generously; if it is leadership, let him govern diligently; if it is showing mercy, let him do it cheerfully. (Romans 12:6-8) NIV
reflection: God's gifts vary in nature, power, and effectiveness according to His wisdom and graciousness, not according to our faith. God will give the special power necessary and appropriate to carry out each responsibility. We can not, by our own effort or willpower, drum up more ability and so be more effective teachers or servants. These are God's gifts to His church, and He gives faith and power as He wills. Our role is to be faithful and to seek ways to serve others with what Christ has give us. When you identify your own gifts (and this list is far from complete), ask how you can use them to build up God's family. At the same time, realize that your gifts can't do the work of the church all alone. Be thankful for people whose gifts are completely different from yours. Let your strengths balance their weaknesses, and be grateful that their abilities make up for your deficiencies. Together you can build Christ's church.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, give me the wisdom and sensitivity to recognize the gifts you have given me that I might help to build up Your church. Help me to recognize that even if my gifts are small they are needed to complete Your work. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God will guide you through the rapids of change...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

We have different gifts according to the grace given to us.
If a man's gift is prophesying, let him use it in proportion to
his faith...

If it is serving, let him serve; if it is teaching, let him teach;

If it is encouraging, let him encourage; if it is contributing,
to the needs of others, let him give generously; if it is
leadership, let him govern diligently; if it is showing mercy,
let him do it cheerfully...(Ro. 12:6-8) NIV

Here Is What We Should Glean From This:

God's gifts vary in nature, power, and effectiveness according
to His wisdom and graciousness, not according to our faith...

God will give the special power necessary and appropriate to
carry out each responsibility. We can not, by our own effort or
willpower, drum up more ability and so be more effective teachers
or servants...

These are God's gifts to His church, and He gives faith and power
as He wills. Our role is to be faithful and to seek ways to serve others with
what Christ has give us...

When you identify your own gifts (and this list is far from complete),
ask how you can use them to build up God's family. At the same time,
realize that your gifts can't do the work of the church all alone...

Be thankful for people whose gifts are completely different from yours.
Let your strengths balance their weaknesses, and be grateful that their 
abilities make up for your deficiencies. Together you can build Christ's
church...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, give me the wisdom and sensitivity to
recognize the gifts you have given me that I might help to build
up Your church. Help me to recognize that even if my gifts are
small they are needed to complete Your work...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has a job for you to do in His church...
You are in the prayers of two who care,,,
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Love must be sincere. Hate what is evil; cling to what is good. (Romans 12:9) NIV
reflection: Most of us have learned how to be courteous to others ~~ how to speak kindly ~~ avoid hurting their feelings ~~ and appear to take an interest in them. We may even be skilled in pretending to show compassion when we hear of others' needs, or to become indignant when we learn of injustice. But God calls us to a real sincere love that goes far beyond being hypocritical and polite. Sincere love requires concentration and effort. It means helping others become better people. It demands our time money, and personal involvement. No individual has the capacity to express love to a whole community, but the body of Christ in your town does. Look for people who need your love and look for ways you and your fellow believers can love your community for Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, cleanse my heart that I may be a vessel for You. Instill in me a pure heart that I may be used by You to be a beacon of light and love for my community. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~He who ignores God is a fool...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Love must be sincere. Hate what is evil; 
cling to what is good...(Ro. 12:9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Most of us have learned how to be courteous to others ~~ how to
speak kindly ~~ avoid hurting their feelings ~~ and appear to take
an interest in them...

We may even be skilled in pretending to show compassion when
we hear of others' needs, or to become indignant when we learn 
of injustice...

But God calls us to a real sincere love that goes far beyond being
hypocritical and polite. Sincere love requires concentration and effort.
It means helping others become better people. It demands our time 
money, and personal involvement...

No individual has the capacity to express love to a whole community, 
but the body of Christ in your town does...

Look for people who need your love and look for ways you and your
fellow believers can love your community for Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, cleanse my heart that I may be
a vessel for You. Instill in me a pure heart that I may be
used by You to be a beacon of light and love for my
community...Amen.

Keep looking up, let Him use you today...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Be devoted to one another in brotherly love. Honor one another above yourselves. (Romans 12:10) NIV
reflection: We can honor others in one of two ways. One involves ulterior motives. We honor our bosses so they will reward us, our employers so they will work harder, the wealthy so they will contribute to our cause, the powerful so they will use their power for us and not against us. God's way involves love. As Christians, We honor people because they have been created in God's image, because they are our brothers and sisters in Christ, and because they have a unique contribution to make to Christ's church. Does God's way of honoring others sound too difficult for your competitive nature? Why not try to outdo one another in showing honor? Put others first!
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I try to honor You as I should ~~ But I often put others down ~~ Forgive me for not honoring others as I should ~~ Forgive me for not honoring You as I should. Amen.
original_content:
God Bless You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~To fear the Lord means giving Him
our reverence, trust, and awe...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Be devoted to one another in brotherly love. Honor one another
above yourselves...(Ro. 12:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We can honor others in one of two ways. One involves ulterior motives.

We honor our bosses so they will reward us, 
our employers so they will work harder, 
the wealthy so they will contribute to our cause, 
the powerful so they will use their power for us and not against us.

God's way involves love. As Christians,

We honor people because they have been created in God's image,
because they are our brothers and sisters in Christ,
and because they have a unique contribution to make to Christ's church.

Does God's way of honoring others sound too difficult for your competitive nature?

Why not try to outdo one another in showing honor? Put others first!

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I try to honor You as I should ~~ 
But I often put others down ~~ Forgive me for not honoring
others as I should ~~ Forgive me for not honoring You as I should...Amen.

Keep looking up, with honor and praise...
Your are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in prayer. (Romans 12:12, 13) NIV
reflection: Verse 12 seems like a tall order in our troubled world today: "Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction." But the next three words hold the answer to how this is possible: "Be faithful in Prayer." Yes we can to take of problems to the Lord. But there is one important lesson we need to learn; we need to learn to leave them there. How often have we taken a certain problem to God, but then have picked it up again and taken with us? The Bible says: "Cast all your cares upon Him [God]; for He careth for you." Are you among the people who believe in the latter part of this verse but never do the first??? What ever your problem, it is not to big for God to handle.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I have this problem which I bring to You today. I know in my heart that You care for me and want only the best for me, so here I lay my burden down and leave it for You to take care of. Amen.
original_content:
God Bless You Today!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Living for Christ brings true freedom...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction, faithful in prayer.
(Ro. 12:12, 13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Verse 12 seems like a tall order in our troubled world today: 
"Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction." But the next three words
hold the answer to how this is possible: "Be faithful in Prayer."

Yes we can to take of problems to the Lord...

But there is one important lesson we need to learn; 
we need to learn to leave them there.

How often have we taken a certain problem to God,
but then have picked it up again and taken with us?

The Bible says: "Cast all your cares upon Him [God];
for He careth for you."

Are you among the people who believe in the latter part
of this verse but never do the first???

What ever your problem, it is not to big for God to handle...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I have this problem ____________
which I bring to You today. I know in my heart that You care

down and leave it for You to take care of...Amen.

Keep looking up, He cares for you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everybody. If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone. do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God's wrath, for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay, " Says the Lord. On the contrary: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head." Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. (John 12:17-21)
reflection: These verses summarize the core of Christian living. if we love someone the way Christ loves us, we will be willing to forgive. If we have experienced God's grace, we will want to pass it on to others. Remember, grace is undeserved favor. By giving an enemy a drink, we are not excusing his misdeeds. We are recognizing him, forgiving him, and loving him in-spit of his sins, just as Christ did for us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a more forgiving heart. When I am wronged help me to forgive and remember that wrong no more. Instill in me a Christ-like heart. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Remember, Christ Died for you...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right 
in the eyes of everybody...

If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone...

do not take revenge, my friends, but leave room for God's wrath, 
for it is written: "It is mine to avenge; I will repay," Says the Lord.

On the contrary: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty,
give him something to drink. In doing this, you will heap burning
coals on his head."

Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good...(Jn. 12:17-21)

Our Lesson for Today:

These verses summarize the core of Christian living. if we love someone
the way Christ loves us, we will be willing to forgive...

If we have experienced God's grace, we will want to pass it on to others.
Remember, grace is undeserved favor...

By giving an enemy a drink, we are not excusing his misdeeds...

We are recognizing him, forgiving him, and loving him in-spit of his sins,
just as Christ did for us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a more forgiving heart.
When I am wronged help me to forgive and remember
that wrong no more. Instill in me a Christ-like heart...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will forgive you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Everyone must submit Himself to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except that which God has established. The authorities that exist have been established by God. (Romans 13:1) NIV
reflection: Are there times when you should not obey the government? Well we should never allow government to force us to disobey God. Jesus and His disciples never disobeyed the government for personal reasons; when they disobeyed, it was in order to follow God's moral standards. Their disobedience was not cheap: They were threatened, beaten, thrown into jail, tortured, and executed for their convictions. Like them, if we are compelled to disobey, we must be ready to accept the consequences.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remain true to Your Word, even in the probability of suffering for my stance. I pray that You wold give me godly wisdom so that I might know Your truth more fully. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Sorry about yesterdays devo. I typed in (Jn. 12:17-21)
when it really was Ro. 12:17-21.

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Everyone must submit Himself to the governing authorities,
for there is no authority except that which God has established.
The authorities that exist have been established by God...(Ro 13:1) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Are there times when you should not obey the government?

Well we should never allow government to force us to disobey
God.

Jesus and His disciples never disobeyed the government for 
personal reasons; when they disobeyed, it was in order to follow
God's moral standards...

Their disobedience was not cheap: They were threatened, beaten, 
thrown into jail, tortured, and executed for their convictions...

Like them, if we are compelled to disobey, we must be ready to
accept the consequences...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remain true to Your Word,
even in the probability of suffering for my stance. I pray that
You wold give me godly wisdom so that I might know Your
truth more fully...Amen.

Keep looking up, seeking godly wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: those who refuse to obey the laws of the land are refusing to obey God, and punishment will follow. For the authorities do not frighten people who are doing right, but they frighten those who are doing wrong. So do what they say, and you will get along well. The authorities are sent by God to help you, but if you are doing something wrong, of course you should be afraid, for you will be punished. The authorities are established for that very purpose, to punish those who do wrong. (Romans 13:2-4) NIV
reflection: When authorities are unjust, upright people are afraid. In these verse, Paul is talking about authorities who are doing their duty. When these officials are just, people who are doing right have nothing to fear. Christians understand Romans 13 in different ways. All Christians agree that we are to live at peace with the state as long as the state allows us to live by our religious convictions. Let us not forget God has placed our countries leaders in charge of keeping peace in the country. Oh yes the country has had some corrupt leaders because they have allowed Satan to corrupt them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray today for godly wisdom for our countries leaders both federal, state and local officials. Help me to submit to these authorities as long as they do not overstep Your will. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Jesus says, "Do not fear for I am with you..."

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: those who refuse to obey the laws of the land are
refusing to obey God, and punishment will follow...

For the authorities do not frighten people who are doing right,
but they frighten those who are doing wrong. So do what they 
say, and you will get along well...

The authorities are sent by God to help you, but if you are doing 
something wrong, of course you should be afraid, for you will be
punished. The authorities are established for that very purpose,
to punish those who do wrong...(Ro. 13:2-4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When authorities are unjust, upright people are afraid. In these 
verse, Paul is talking about authorities who are doing their duty.

When these officials are just, people who are doing right have 
nothing to fear...

Christians understand Ro. 13 in different ways. All Christians 
agree that we are to live at peace with the state as long as the 
state allows us to live by our religious convictions...

Let us not forget God has placed our countries leaders in
charge of keeping peace in the country...

Oh yes the country has had some corrupt leaders because 
they have allowed Satan to corrupt them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray today for godly wisdom for
our countries leaders both federal, state and local officials.
Help me to submit to these authorities as long as they do
not over-step Your will...Amen.

Keep looking up, do not anxiously look around you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let no debt remain outstanding except the continuing debt to love one another, for he who loves his fellowman has fulfilled the law. (Romans 13:8) NIV
reflection: Why is love for others called a debt??? We need to remember we are permanently in debt to Christ for the lavish love He has poured out on us. The only way we can even begin to repay this debt is by loving others in turn. Because Christ's love will always be infinitely greater than ours, we will always have the obligation to love our neighbors.
prayer: Dear Lord, teach me to be more loving toward others. Help me to always be ready to offer a loving hand to those on need. Help me to have a Christ-like love. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Helping someone in Jesus' name is your
most important work for the day...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Let no debt remain outstanding except the continuing 
debt to love one another, for he who loves his fellowman
has fulfilled the law...(Ro 13:8) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Why is love for others called a debt???

We need to remember we are permanently in debt to Christ for
the lavish love He has poured out on us...

The only way we can even begin to repay this debt is by loving
others in turn...

Because Christ's love will always be infinitely greater than ours,
we will always have the obligation to love our neighbors...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, teach me to be more loving toward others.
Help me to always be ready to offer a loving hand to
those on need...Help me to have a Christ-like love...Amen.

Keep looking up, He says He will help us...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The commandments, "Do not commit adultery, " "Do not murder, " "Do not steal, " "Do not covet, " and whatever other commandment there may be, are summed up in this one rule: "Love your neighbor as yourself." (Romans 13:9) NIV
reflection: Somehow many of us have gotten the idea that self-love is wrong. But if this were the case, it would be pointless to love our neighbor as ourselves. But Paul explains what he means by self-love. Even if you have low self esteem, you probably don't willingly let yourself go hungry. You take care of your body and may even exercise. You cloth yourself reasonably well. You make sure there is a roof over your head. You try not to let yourself be cheated or injured. This is the kind of love we need to have for our neighbors. Do we see that others are fed, clothed, and housed as well as they can be? Are we concerned about issues of social justice? Loving others as ourselves means actively working to see that their needs are met. It is interesting that people who focus on others rather than themselves rarely suffer from low self-esteem.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be sensitive to the needs of others. Help me to lend a helping hand to those less fortunate then I. open the doors of opportunity for me to be of assistance to those in need. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~God has promised not to leave us helpless...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

The commandments, "Do not commit adultery," "Do not murder,"
"Do not steal," "Do not covet," and whatever other commandment
there may be, are summed up in this one rule: "Love your neighbor 
as yourself." (Ro. 13:9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Somehow many of us have gotten the idea that self-love is wrong.
But if this were the case, it would be pointless to love our neighbor
as ourselves...

But Paul explains what he means by self-love. Even if you have low
self esteem, you probably don't willingly let yourself go hungry. You
take care of your body and may even exercise...

You cloth yourself reasonably well. You make sure there is a roof 
over your head. You try not to let yourself be cheated or injured...

This is the kind of love we need to have for our neighbors. Do we 
see that others are fed, clothed, and housed as well as they can be?

Are we concerned about issues of social justice? Loving others as 
ourselves means actively working to see that their needs are met.

It is interesting that people who focus on others rather than themselves
rarely suffer from low self-esteem...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be sensitive to the needs 
of others. Help me to lend a helping hand to those less fortunate 
then I. open the doors of opportunity for me to be of assistance
to those in need...Amen.

Keep looking up, to the one who is steadfast and sure...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Love does no harm to its neighbor. Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law. (Romans 13:10) NIV
reflection: Christians must obey the law of love, which supersedes both religious and civil laws. How easy it is to excuse our indifference to others merely because we have no legal obligation to help them and even justify harming them if our actions are technically legal! But Jesus does not leave loopholes in the law of love. Whenever love demands it, we are to go beyond human legal requirements and imitate the God of love.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for Your love and mercy. Instill in me a Christ-like love, so that I may not sin against You. Forgive me for not always being as loving as I should be. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~In all things ~ give thanks...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Love does no harm to its neighbor. Therefore love is the
fulfillment of the law...(Ro. 13:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Christians must obey the law of love, which supersedes
both religious and civil laws. How easy it is to excuse our
indifference to others merely because we have no legal
obligation to help them and even justify harming them if
our actions are technically legal!

But Jesus does not leave loopholes in the law of love.
Whenever love demands it, we are to go beyond human
legal requirements and imitate the God of love...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for Your love and mercy.
Instill in me a Christ-like love, so that I may not sin against 
You. Forgive me for not always being as loving as I should
be...Amen.

Keep looking up, we have a forgiving God...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. so let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light. Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in orgies and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not in dissension and jealousy. Rather, clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not think about how to gratify the desires of the sinful nature. (Romans, 13:12-14) NIV
reflection: The "night" refers to the present evil time. The "day" refers to the time of Christ's return. When Christ returns He wants to find His people clean on the inside as well as on the outside. Now the only way that can become possible is to let Christ take control of us. So how do we let Christ take control of our life??? (first) we identify with Christ by being baptized (Galatians 3:27). This shows our solidarity with other Christians and with the death, burial, and resurrection of Jesus Christ. (second) we exemplify the qualities Jesus showed while He was here on earth (love, humility, truth, service). In a sense, we roleplay what Jesus would do in our situation. We must also avoid those situations that open the door to gratifying sinful desires.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your guidance so that I would always exemplify Your qualities. I pray that through Your guidance love, humility, truth, and service for the kingdom would become a natural part of my life. Help me to always avoid those situations that would open the door to gratifying sinful desires. Amen.
original_content:
Happy Thanksgiving!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Always be thankful...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. so let us
put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of
light.

Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in orgies and 
drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not 
in dissension and jealousy...

Rather, clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do
not think about how to gratify the desires of the sinful nature.
(Ro, 13:12-14) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The "night" refers to the present evil time. The "day" refers to
the time of Christ's return...

When Christ returns He wants to find His people clean on the
inside as well as on the outside...

Now the only way that can become possible is to let Christ take
control of us. So how do we let Christ take control of our life???

(first) we identify with Christ by being baptized (Gal. 3:27).
This shows our solidarity with other Christians and with the death,
burial, and resurrection of Jesus Christ...

(second) we exemplify the qualities Jesus showed while He was 
here on earth (love, humility, truth, service). In a sense, we roleplay what Jesus would do in our situation...

We must also avoid those situations that open the door to
gratifying sinful desires...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your guidance so that I would
always exemplify Your qualities. I pray that through Your guidance
love, humility, truth, and service for the kingdom would become a
natural part of my life. Help me to always avoid those situations
that would open the door to gratifying sinful desires...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of thankfulness...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: Accept him whose faith is weak, without passing judgment on disputable matters. (Romans 14:1) NIV
reflection: This verse assumes there will be differences of opinion in the church about what is right or wrong. Paul says we are not to quarrel about issues that are matters of opinion. Differences should not be feared or avoided but accepted and handled with love. Don't expect everyone, even in the best possible church, to agree on every subject. Through the sharing of ideas we can come to a fuller understanding of what the Bible teaches. Accept, listen to, and respect others. Differences of opinion need not cause division. they can be a source of learning and richness in our relationships.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always be open to the opinions of others, without becoming judgmental. For I know You are the final judge. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Thankfulness should not be limited to one day

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says: Accept him whose faith is weak, without passing
judgment on disputable matters...(Ro. 14:1) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

This verse assumes there will be differences of opinion in
the church about what is right or wrong. Paul says we are 
not to quarrel about issues that are matters of opinion...

Differences should not be feared or avoided but accepted 
and handled with love. Don't expect everyone, even in the
best possible church, to agree on every subject...

Through the sharing of ideas we can come to a fuller understanding of what the Bible teaches. Accept, listen to, and
respect others...

Differences of opinion need not cause division. they can be
a source of learning and richness in our relationships...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always be open
to the opinions of others, without becoming judgmental.
For I know You are the final judge...Amen.

Keep looking up, for Godly-wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: One man's faith allows him to eat everything, but another man, whose faith is weak, eats only vegetables. The man who eats everything must not look down on him who does not, and the man who does not eat everything must not condemn the man who does, for God has accepted him. (Romans 14:2, 3) NIV
reflection: Eating "anything" may refer to a strong Christian being free from dietary restrictions, or it may refer to his eating meat offered to idols. The person weaker in the faith, however may eat only vegetables and refuse to eat meat that has been offered to idols. But how would Christians end up eating meat that had been offered to idols? The ancient system of sacrifice was at the center of the religious, social, and domestic life of the Roman world. After a sacrifice was presented to a god in a pagan temple, only part of it was burned. The remainder was often sent to the market to be sold. Thus, a Christian might easily ~ even unknowingly ~ Buy such meat in the market place or eat it at the home of a friend. Should a friend question the source of the meat? Some thought there was nothing wrong with eating meat that had been offered to idols because idols were worthless. Others carefully checked the source of their meat or gave up meat altogether, in order to avoid a guilty conscience. What does this have to do with us today? Well whether your conscience bothers you because of something you eat or possibly because of certain conduct, you should seek a clearer understanding of what you are doing ~ It just could be the Holy Spirit speaking to you. He may want you to pray for direction.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for a deeper sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's guidance in my life. Help me to live within Your will each day. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Always Kneel before the Lord in
an attitude of gratitude...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

One man's faith allows him to eat everything, but another man, 
whose faith is weak, eats only vegetables...

The man who eats everything must not look down on him who 
does not, and the man who does not eat everything must not
condemn the man who does, for God has accepted him. (Ro. 14:2, 3) NIV 

Our Lesson for Today:

Eating "anything" may refer to a strong Christian being free from dietary 
restrictions, or it may refer to his eating meat offered to idols...

The person weaker in the faith, however may eat only vegetables and 
refuse to eat meat that has been offered to idols...

But how would Christians end up eating meat that had been offered 
to idols?

The ancient system of sacrifice was at the center of the religious, social, 
and domestic life of the Roman world...

After a sacrifice was presented to a god in a pagan temple, only part of 
it was burned. The remainder was often sent to the market to be sold...

Thus, a Christian might easily ~ even unknowingly ~ Buy such meat in the 
market place or eat it at the home of a friend...

Should a friend question the source of the meat? Some thought there was 
nothing wrong with eating meat that had been offered to idols because 
idols were worthless...

Others carefully checked the source of their meat or gave up meat altogether, 
in order to avoid a guilty conscience...

What does this have to do with us today?

Well whether your conscience bothers you because of something you eat or 
possibly because of certain conduct, you should seek a clearer understanding
of what you are doing ~ It just could be the Holy Spirit speaking to you...

He may want you to pray for direction...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for a deeper sensitivity to Your
Holy Spirit's guidance in my life. Help me to live within Your 
will each day...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to direct your path...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You, then, why do you judge your brother? or why do you look down on your brother? For we will stand before God's judgment seat. It is written, "As surely as I live, " says the Lord, "Every knee will bow before me; Every tongue will confess to God." So then each of us will give an account of himself to God. Therefore let us stop passing judgment on one another. instead, make up your mind not to put any stumbling block or obstacle in your brothers ways. As one who is in the Lord Jesus, I am fully convinced that no food is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, it is unclean. (Romans 14:10-14) NIV
reflection: Each person is accountable to Christ, not to others. While the church has to be uncompromising in its stand against activities that are expressly forbidden by the scripture (adultery, homosexuality, murder, theft), it should not create additional rules and regulations and give them equal standing with God's law.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for my sins of thought, word, or deed. Create in me a pure heart that I may not become a slave to sin. Amen.
original_content:
Have A Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for though)~~~Your most important work is helping
someone in Jesus name...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

You, then, why do you judge your brother? or why do you
look down on your brother? For we will stand before God's
judgment seat.

It is written, "As surely as I live," says the Lord, "Every knee will
bow before me; Every tongue will confess to God." 

So then each of us will give an account of himself to God...

Therefore let us stop passing judgment on one another. instead,
make up your mind not to put any stumbling block or obstacle in
your brothers ways...

As one who is in the Lord Jesus, I am fully convinced that no food 
is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, it is
unclean...(Ro. 14:10-14) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Each person is accountable to Christ, not to others...

While the church has to be uncompromising in its stand against
activities that are expressly forbidden by the scripture (adultery,
homosexuality, murder, theft), it should not create additional
rules and regulations and give them equal standing with God's
law...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for my sins of thought, word,
or deed. Create in me a pure heart that I may not become a
slave to sin...Amen.

Keep looking up, you are accountable to Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food, all food is clean, but it is wrong for a man to eat anything that causes someone else to stumble. It is better not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything else that will cause your brother to fall. (Romans 14:20, 21) NIV
reflection: Remember, sin is not a private matter. Everything we do affects others, and we have to think of them constantly. God created us to be interdependent, not independent. We who are strong in our faith must, without pride or condescension, treat others with love, patience, and self-restraint.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father help me to always be mindful of the feeling of others. Help me to refrain from doing anything that may cause someone to stumble. Help me to be sensitive to the feelings of others. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Run the race of life with eternity in view...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food, all food
is clean, but it is wrong for a man to eat anything that causes 
someone else to stumble...

It is better not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything else
that will cause your brother to fall...(Ro. 14:20, 21) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Remember, sin is not a private matter. Everything we do
affects others, and we have to think of them constantly...

God created us to be interdependent, not independent...

We who are strong in our faith must, without pride or
condescension, treat others with love, patience, and
self-restraint...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father help me to always be mindful
of the feeling of others. Help me to refrain from doing
anything that may cause someone to stumble...Help 
me to be sensitive to the feelings of others...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His guidance...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The man who has doubts is condemned if he eats, because his eating is not from faith; and everything that does not come from faith is sin. (Romans 14:23) NIV
reflection: We try to stay clear of actions forbidden by the Scripture of course, but sometimes Scripture is silent. That is when we need to follow our conscience."If you do anything you believe is not right you are sinning" means that to go against conviction will leave a person with a guilty or uneasy conscience. When God shows that something is wrong for us, we should avoid it. But we should not look down on other Christian who exercise their freedom in those areas.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always be sensitive to my conscience. Help me to keep from being judgmental. Help me to walk the path of our Savior. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The church's one foundation is Jesus Christ our Lord...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

The man who has doubts is condemned if he eats, because 
his eating is not from faith; and everything that does not come 
from faith is sin...(Ro. 14:23) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We try to stay clear of actions forbidden by the Scripture of course,
but sometimes Scripture is silent. That is when we need to follow
our conscience. 

"If you do anything you believe is not right you are sinning" means
that to go against conviction will leave a person with a guilty or uneasy 
conscience...

When God shows that something is wrong for us, we should avoid it. 
But we should not look down on other Christian who exercise their 
freedom in those areas...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always be sensitive 
to my conscience. Help me to keep from being judgmental.
Help me to walk the path of our Savior...Amen.

Keep looking up, don't become a doubter...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We who are strong ought to bear with the failings of the weak and not to please ourselves. Each of us should please his neighbor for his good, to build him up. (Romans 15:1, 2) NIV
reflection: If we merely set out to please our neighbor, we will be people pleases (Galatians 1:10). We are to set aside willfulness and self-pleasing actions for the sake of building others up. Our Christian convictions must not be a disguise for cold-hearted treatment of our neighbors. Paul says: (Galatians 1:10) "Am I now trying to win the approval of men, or of God? Or am I trying to please men? If I were trying to please men, I would not be a servant of Christ."
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to correct my priorities, help me to put You first in all that I do, but also help me to be a good neighbor. Forgive me for putting self first. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The church to attend is where Christ is preached...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

We who are strong ought to bear with the failings of the weak
and not to please ourselves...

Each of us should please his neighbor for his good, to build
him up...(Ro. 15:1, 2) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

If we merely set out to please our neighbor, we will be people
pleasers (Gal 1:10)...

We are to set aside willfulness and self-pleasing actions for
the sake of building others up. Our Christian convictions must 
not be a disguise for cold-hearted treatment of our neighbors...

Paul says: (Gal. 1:10) "Am I now trying to win the approval of 
men, or of God? Or am I trying to please men? If I were trying 
to please men, I would not be a servant of Christ."

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to correct my priorities, 
help me to put You first in all that I do, but also help me
to be a good neighbor. Forgive me for putting self first...Amen.

Keep looking up, He should always be first in your mind...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For even Christ did not please Himself but, as it is written: "The insults of those who insult you have fallen on Me." For everything that was written in the past was written to teach us, so that through endurance and the encouragement of the Scriptures we might have hope. (Romans 15:3, 4) NIV
reflection: If we seek a sensitivity to the Lord's will, true knowledge of the Scriptures will affect our attitude toward the present and the future. The more we know about what God has done in years past, the greater the confidence we will have about what He will do in the days ahead. We need to diligently read our Bible so we have the confidence that God's will is best for us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always trusting in You to lead me in the best way. Forgive me when I hesitate to step out in faith. Help me Lord to trust You more. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!!~~(food for thought)~~What does Jesus think about my thoughts and actions?

Our Bible Verses for Today:

For even Christ did not please Himself but, as it is written:
"The insults of those who insult you have fallen on Me."

For everything that was written in the past was written to 
teach us, so that through endurance and the encouragement 
of the Scriptures we might have hope...(Ro.15:3, 4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

If we seek a sensitivity to the Lord's will, true knowledge of the 
Scriptures will affect our attitude toward the present and the future.

The more we know about what God has done in years past, the
greater the confidence we will have about what He will do in the 
days ahead...

We need to diligently read our Bible so we have the confidence
that God's will is best for us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always trusting
in You to lead me in the best way. Forgive me when I hesitate
to step out in faith. Help me Lord to trust You more...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will make the way clear...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you a spirit of unity among yourselves as you follow Christ Jesus, so that with one heart and mouth you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. Accept one another, then. just as Christ accepted you, in order to bring praise to God. (Romans 15:5-7) NIV
reflection: Just as we take Jesus' view on the authority of Scripture, the nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to have His attitude of love toward other Christians as well. As we grow in faith and come to know Jesus better, we will become more capable of maintaining His attitude of loving unity throughout each day. If you wish to know more about Christ's attitude read (Phi. 2)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to make an attitude adjustment. Help me to have a Christ-like attitude ~ one of loving concern for other people. Help me not to judge people on first impressions. Amen.
original_content:
Have a Blessed Day!!! ~ (food for thought) ~ First impressions often lead to wrong conclusions...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you
a spirit of unity among yourselves as you follow Christ Jesus,

so that with one heart and mouth you may glorify the God and
Father of our Lord Jesus Christ...

Accept one another, then. just as Christ accepted you, in order 
to bring praise to God...(Ro 15:5-7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Just as we take Jesus' view on the authority of Scripture, the 
nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to have His 
attitude of love toward other Christians as well...

As we grow in faith and come to know Jesus better, we will
become more capable of maintaining His attitude of loving
unity throughout each day...

If you wish to know more about Christ's attitude read (Phi. 2)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to make an attitude adjustment.
Help me to have a Christ-like attitude ~ one of loving concern
for other people. Help me not to judge people on first impressions...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will help you with your flawed impressions...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
